nodes.bodyText: Have you checked the case when user name is null? getUserName() may return null if there is no user name, while getDisplayName() always return a string.
Yes, and it works for a jmri.Block and a jmri.Reporter. Will change it to getDisplayName(). Thanks!

I think it would be better to move this class to its own file, ReporterBlockTableModel.java, instead of moving it to the ManageLocationsAction class.
There is no reference to ReporterBlockTableModel in the ManageLocationsAction class, so I don't think ReporterBlockTableModel should belong to ManageLocationsAction.

This import is redundant. You don't need to import from the same package. Sometimes I have seen that the IDE (for example NetBeans) has added these wrongly.
The PR looks good, but the Static Analysis CI check complains about it so it needs to be fixed before the PR is merged.
Thank you. Now fixed. It was my mistake.
